alert.note: Alert for Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 07 at 10:41PM PDT until August 09 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING POSSIBLE MONDAY AND TUESDAY FOR CENTRAL OREGON... .An oncoming system originating from just off the California coast will lift up along the Oregon coast starting late tonight. Isolated storms are possible with little rain starting Monday afternoon. For Tuesday, storms may be wetter in nature, but lightning strikes along the periphery of storm cells and outflow winds may exacerbate fire spread conditions for the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MONDAY TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE OR611... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 611 - Deschutes National Forest -minus Sisters Ranger District. * IMPACTS...Lightning and high fire danger will likely result in new fire starts. Gusty thunderstorm winds could contribute to fire spread. Despite rainfall, initial attack resources could be overwhelmed and holdover fires are possible. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated thunderstorm activity will begin starting Monday afternoon. Activity may linger overnight into Tuesday, when storms may be wetter in nature. Lightning Activity level around 3 expected. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Outflow wind gusts near thunderstorms could approach 30 to 40 mph.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District
